I am Alfesar, a friar from the San d'Oria Cathedral. I have come to study the Altepa Desert and its surroundings.${prompt}

Until only recently, the monster-infested Korroloka Tunnel has been a barrier between the Quon continent and Zepwell Island. But with the clearing of that tunnel, I was able to make my way here.${prompt}
On your way here to Rabao, I'm sure you saw the ruins of ages past half-buried in the sand. I have been given the task of investigating those ruins.${prompt}
Several days ago, a researcher I hired brought back ${keyitem-article: 0[2]} inscribed with ancient writings. He found it in the expansive Quicksand Caves that lie beneath the Altepa Desert.${prompt}
This was a major discovery. According to a scholar of ancient literature, the inscription on the tablet appears to be some kind of spell.${prompt}
Unfortunately, with an important part of the tablet broken away, we were unable to decipher the full meaning.${prompt}
I am still undergoing training and do not possess the ability to survive a foray into a place like the Quicksand Caves. And so, I turn to you.${prompt}
${name-player}, you are highly regarded as an accomplished adventurer. I wish to employ you to venture into the Quicksand Caves and find the remaining ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}
I humbly beg this favor of you.${prompt}
The tablet I have was found in the Quicksand Caves that lie beneath the Altepa Desert. The ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will most likely be among other rubble and debris.${prompt}
This is, without a doubt, the ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Please take the completed ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} and this letter of introduction.${prompt}
With these in your possession, go and meet with Charlaimagnat on the lower level of the San d'Oria Cathedral.${prompt}
Please hand this letter of introduction and the ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} to Charlaimagnat. He can be found on the lower level of the San d'Oria Cathedral.${prompt}
I received a letter from Charlaimagnat informing me of the safe arrival of the ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]}. I am most grateful for your assistance.${prompt}
You have performed a great service for us.
${name-player}, may Paradise open its gates to you.${prompt}
The desert is crossed by all sorts of people, not just you adventurers. Like us caravan merchants, for instance.${prompt}
Sometimes we gotta dump our goods and run like hell when we get attacked by monsters out there. Your life is the most valuable thing ya got, pal.${prompt}
Some of the more nasty critters out there are those huge scorpions. They gotta be more'n twice my height, and naturally the sting in the tail'll shoot ya full of poison.${prompt}

Those scorpions are a real pain in the backside, if ya get my meaning. It's fine if ya happen to be best friends with a white mage, but out here you'll find more bruisers than healers. If ya don't got a good stock of antidotes, you're a dead man.${prompt}
'Course, the main ingredient for that antidote just happens to be ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}.${prompt}
An adventurer like yourself should see where I'm going with this. I want ya to go out and get me ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}.${prompt}
Oh, I really thought ya would've helped us out...
Well, sorry for taking up ya time.${prompt}
Now get out there, whack some of them scorpions, and bring me ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}. I'll have ya reward waiting for ya.${prompt}
I won't bore ya with a long speech. If ya feel up to getting us some ${item-singular: 1[2]}, I'll be standing right here.${prompt}
Got me ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} yet? I took ya to be a competent adventurer, but don't go getting yourself killed out there.${prompt}
Now I can make me some antidote. Thanks, pal.
Here's your reward, like I promised.${prompt}
If ya come across any more of the stuff, bring it to me, and I'll buy it off ya.${prompt}
Can't have enough of this stuff. Take this for ya troubles.${prompt}
I asked ya to bring me ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}.
Get ya head out of the sand. Ya won't be getting a reward until ya bring me what I asked for.${prompt}
You're carrying too much stuff. Go sell or drop the junk ya don't need, then bring me the thing I asked for.${prompt}
If ya come across any more ${item-plural: 1[2]}, bring 'em to me and I'll buy 'em off ya.${prompt}
After going through all the trouble of drawing up the water for the oasis, the pioneers of this place stocked it with fish. You can't argue with that kind of thoroughness, hehehe.${prompt}
The Antica beastmen that make their homes here are covered in rigid plates.
It's like they're born with a natural suit of armor.${prompt}
You won't be able to make a dent on them without a decent weapon.
So saying, I still have to get a new sword, myself. Being a warrior can be so expensive...${prompt}
There's a cave system at the north edge of the Western Altepa Desert called the Kuftal Tunnel. Cape Teriggan lies at the other end of those caves.${prompt}
A few decades ago, you could easily travel from the cape further into the Quon continent. However, that path was lost when the land itself shifted during the Great War.${prompt}
The ruins that are buried beneath the desert in the Quicksand Caves were once a splendor-wendorous construction of the Galka.${prompt}
Long before either you or I were born, in an age when the Antica and the Galka waged war for dominance over the region, those buildings used to stand on the surface of the desert.${prompt}
And now they crumble below the shifting sands...
Even as a Tarutaru, it gets me down. The home of an entire race, disappearing from the light of the sun...${prompt}
You see those windmills spinning atop the towers?
They use the power of the wind to draw water up from deep beneath the earth.${prompt}
Even during the dry months, Rabao never lacks for water.
Getting the water up to the surface originally must have been quite a feat, though.${prompt}
You should show your gratitude to the pioneers of this place.
Why, my heart's about to burst from all the gratitude I'm feeling.
Thank you, thank you, thank you...!${prompt}
From ages past, Zepwell Island has been treated as a forbidden land. The passages here from the mainland, the Gustav and Korroloka tunnels, have been inaccessible.${prompt}
But adventurers rarely heed words like “forbidden,” now do they? You seem like one of those types.${prompt}
A group of like-minded people, avoiding the authorities from their countries, made their way to this island. They set up shop here, using this oasis as a base.${prompt}
This is Rabao, a town founded by adventurers.${prompt}
I braved the long, arrrduous journey from the mainland to search for trrreasure in the Quicksand Caves.${prompt}
It's been a little harrrder than I expected, though.
The Quicksand Caves are extensive and verrry confusing.${prompt}
On top of that, there are all these ant-type beastmen crawling around down there. Not a nice place to be looking for lost rrriches!${prompt}
The rrroad to hidden trrreasure is long indeed...${prompt}
You probably weren't aware of it, but this island is the lost homeland of the Galka...
Even in these endless sands, the joy of setting foot in your homeland is a difficult emotion to express.${prompt}
Behold! The sign upon this arch proclaims the existence of the auction house beyond. A bounty of food and supplies in the center of the desert! What more could one ask for in this life?${prompt}
A little further north of here is the Rabao oasis. It's not much, but there are goods for sale in the tents.${prompt}

Outside of Rabao, the desert stretches for as far as the eye can see. Rabao is the only place to gather supplies for your journey and acts as a waypoint for adventurers. It's important for us to work together out here.${prompt}
This is Rabao, a precious oasis in the middle of the vast Altepa Desert.
Take the chance to revitalize yourself before continuing on your journey.${prompt}
When your pack is fit to burrrst, send your non-essential items to your delivery box and bam, prrroblem solved!${prompt}
We can deliver goods to your residence or to the residences of your friends.${prompt}
My name is Cavalgrinne, and I'm in charge of the auction house services.${prompt}
There are no set prices in the auction house.
Don't forget to check the price history when you make a bid or put an item up for sale.${prompt}
Browsing the auction house is free!
Checking the goods for sale every day can turn up some truly wondrous items.${prompt}
If you're looking for a weapon to carve through those desert beasts, you've come to the right place.${prompt}
For rainy days and windy days, or for days when someone tries to thrust a spear in your guts, having a good set of armor can set your mind at ease.${prompt}
These days, you can get weapons and armor cheap at the auction houses. But magic is expensive no matter where you go.${prompt}
No problem, Scamplix not bad guy. Scamplix is good guy, sells stuff to adventurers. Scamplix got lots of good stuff for you.${prompt}

For your own safety, it is recommended that you set this location as your home point after changing jobs.${prompt}
Never heard that name before. Is that somebody famous?
Hmm. I'm guessing you haven't been taking on many requests from people.
You know, if you keep that up, no one is going to remember you.${prompt}
Even doing small favors is fine at first. If you help out a lot of different people, you'll slowly gain their trust. Before you know it, everyone will know your name.${prompt}
I think I have some vague memory of hearing that name somewhere... Nope, it's gone.${prompt}
But this just goes to show how few people know you around here. You've gotta put yourself out there more, my young adventurer friend.${prompt}
I've heard that name before. Seems you're building yourself a good reputation.${prompt}
But you've still got a long way to go until you can say you're truly famous. The journey of a thousand miles starts with a single step, so keep at it!${prompt}
I've heard your name mentioned once or twice around these parts lately.${prompt}
You're coming up in the world, but don't slow down now!${prompt}
Your name comes up quite a lot in conversation these days.
You must be keeping busy out there.${prompt}

Listening to the talk about you around the oasis just makes me swell up with pride. I know it's strange, but I love to hear about adventurers doing well in Rabao. Keep up the good work, ${name-player}.${prompt}
There's hardly a soul in all of Rabao who hasn't heard your name!
I could hardly believe the stir you've been making.${prompt}
You've entered the ranks of the truly great adventurers! But don't be content with your position; aim for the very top!${prompt}
Every time I speak with you, you seem to have gained in status. Pretty soon, I'm gonna have to start making appointments to talk to you!${prompt}
There isn't a person in the whole of Rabao who hasn't heard of you. I never dreamed you would come so far!${prompt}
Your endeavors in neighboring countries have reached us here in Rabao, and the glory of your reputation precedes you.${prompt}
I feel honored to have known you before you became so famous. Good luck with your continuing adventurers!${prompt}
I've known you since you were just starting out around here, but to think you would go on to achieve such glory...${prompt}
In Rabao and beyond, your name is on everyone's lips.
It wouldn't be going too far to say you've achieved the status of hero in my eyes.${prompt}
May the blessings of the Goddess Altana watch over your continuing endeavors.${prompt}
Owzie-wowzie! Don't make me talk. I hurt all over!${prompt}
Try though you may, there will come a time when failure is inevitable.${prompt}
Channel that agony and bitterness into creating a new plan.${prompt}
Owzie-wowzie! Don't make me talk. I hurt all over!${prompt}
Yippee! This is my lucky day!${prompt}
Let me introduce myself. I am from the Rhinostery in Windurst. I do research on various living things.${prompt}
And I'm the besty-westy they've got! I've been looking into phenomena at a certain place.${prompt}
What phenomena, you ask? Well, there are these giant crystals, you see!
And from those crystals, a strangey-wangey power is constantly pouring forth...${prompt}
These crystals are found all over Vana'diel, and their energies affect the surrounding ecosystems.
Our research team had been investigating the unusual emanations when...${prompt}
We finally succeeded in awakening the crystals!${prompt}
Our theory on what lay dormant inside the crystals was proven to be rightaru on the money!
Except they didn't appreciate being woken up...
Why do they so despise talking with us that they would rather fight?
And what on Vana'diel would happen if someone were to defeat them?${prompt}
I bet you could do it!
You call yourself an adventurer, right? Give it a shot!${prompt}
Here, take this ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]}. But be warned--only a person who carries one can enter the crystal.${prompt}

This ${keyitem-singular: 1[2]} will awaken the giant crystal that is found ${choice: 2}[in Ifrit's Cauldron/in the Quicksand Caves/in the Den of Rancor/in Cape Teriggan/in Fei'Yin/in The Boyahda Tree].${prompt}
Without it, you won't be getting inside no matter how sneaky-weaky you are!
Oh, and if you want to take some friends with you, they also have to get ${keyitem-article: 1[2]} from me. Okey-dokey?${prompt}
If you don't prepare yourself for battle, you'll get beaten to a pulp, like we did! ${prompt}
As soon as we gather our companions, we'll be jumping into the fray again.
I just hope this little researcher doesn't get in our way...${prompt}
If I don't go with you, there's no pointaru to the research now, is there?${prompt}
Wowy-wow-wow! You defeated a prime avatar!${prompt}
The prime avatar said that to you?
I wonder what it could mean.${prompt}
...You will forget what I have said...${prompt}
What...do you desire...? What...do you seek?${prompt}
Gil is what you truly want?
Listen...to the voice without--my voice--with your ears...and your heart...${prompt}
Listen to the voice within you!${prompt}
If you focus, you will see the true Vana'diel!${prompt}
Huh? I went all spacey-wacey for a moment there...${prompt}
Was I speaking with you? What were we talking about?${prompt}
Did I tell you I'm a researcher from the Rhinostery in Windurst already?${prompt}
You are now able to summon ${choice: 2}[Ifrit/Titan/Leviathan/Garuda/Shiva/Ramuh].${prompt}
Do I know where Ildy-Goldy is?${prompt}
He went off towards Cape Terrrigan with the ${color: 5}improved tuning fork of air${color: 1}.${prompt}
Ildy-Goldy will wipe the floor with that avatar.
I wonder what kind of research data he'll bring back for us?${prompt}
Hm? Did he seem a little different from usual?${prompt}
Well, now that you mention it, he did ask me to give this to any adventurers that came looking for him...${prompt}
I guess that must mean you.
Here you go. Seems like a clear invitation to go take on the avatar in Cape Teriggan yourself.${prompt}
I've given you what Ildy-Goldy had me hold on to. You should be on your way to Cape Teriggan.${prompt}
You're going to help out Ildy-Goldy, but first you want to take on the avatar in Cape Teriggan under your own steam?${prompt}
I like to do things my way...
Well, either way is fine with me.${prompt}
What kind of an adventurer are you...?
Well, don't go losing this one, okay?${prompt}
...There is no need for violence, adventurer...${prompt}
...I just wish to ask you som-m-me questions.
...Why do you think the avatars...give power to people...without a reason...?${prompt}
Oh, all right... But be careful-wareful with this one! These things don't grow on star trees, you know.${prompt}
Maybe you can help us out.${prompt}
Let me introduce myself and my companion. We're from the Rhinostery in Windurst.${prompt}

I was hired by the ministry to accompany this researcher to ${choice: 2}[Ifrit's Cauldron/the Quicksand Caves/the Den of Rancor/Cape Teriggan/Fei'Yin/the Boyahda Tree] and assist him in his study of a series of giant crystals.${prompt}
But what was waiting for us inside those crystals was more than I could deal with...${prompt}
We tried countless times, but I could not defeat that beast.
Another researcher at the Rhinostery sympathized with our plight and developed an improved tuning fork.${prompt}
That crazy-wazy contraption won't provide us with any useful data!${prompt}
Science is not about winning or spinning, life or strife, even or Steven! It's a more delicate subjectaru!${prompt}
Do you see what I have to deal with? I don't know how much longer I can work with such a pessimist.${prompt}
I was thinking of letting one of you adventurers test out the new fork and prove to my colleague that it is able to return data valuable to his research.${prompt}
Even if they use that half-rate spork, it'll take a tip-top summoner to defeat the prime avatar!${prompt}

The fandangled ${item-singular: 1[2]} won't make it any easier for you to downright defeat the monster inside the crystal. Sure, it'll lower the power of the prime avatar to around ${number: 3}, but it will do the same to you! And on top of that, you'll only be able to summon that itty-bitty blue bugger, Carbuncle!${prompt}
And to make things worse, nobody-buddy else can enter the crystal with you! You'll be battling one-on-one, man-to-man, Taru-et-Taru!${prompt}
Yes, but sir... The Rhinostery has been pressing us to produce results. If we do not take some sort of action quickly...${prompt}
You do have a point there...
I guess one round with a prime avatar wouldn't hurtaru.${prompt}
No, one round could not hurt.${prompt}
You know that you probably won't gain anything from this battle-waddle.
Are you sure you still want the fork?${prompt}
Take this ${item-singular: 1[2]} and ring it near one of those giant crystals. The prime avatar won't be slap-happy to be woken up, and you'll have to deal with its wrath.${prompt}

I guess because you are helping us check out this new tuning fork, I can use my mighty-minty magic to warp you near the giant crystal in ${choice: 2}[Ifrit's Cauldron/the Quicksand Caves/the Den of Rancor/Cape Teriggan/Fei'Yin/the Boyahda Tree]. When you're ready, just show my companion the ${item-singular: 1[2]}.${prompt}
The researcher who made the ${item-singular: 1[2]} warned that “the door home would only open to those who defeated the prime avatar.”${prompt}
I'm not quite sure what that is supposed to mean, but I suggest that you prepare well before taking on this journey.
Remember, you have to be at least a level ${number: 3} summoner.${prompt}
Are you and Carbuncle ready to fight the prime avatar as a level ${number: 3} summoner?${prompt}
Also, regardless of whether you defeat the avatar or not, you will be unable to re-enter the protocrystal again for a number of days.${prompt}
Are you sure you are ready?
Off to ${choice: 2}[Ifrit's Cauldron/the Quicksand Caves/the Den of Rancor/Cape Teriggan/Fei'Yin/the Boyahda Tree]!
My dog ate my ${color: 5}mini tuning fork${color: 1}.
Sir, our adventurer has completed ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] preparations and requests a warp.${prompt}
Don't use that excuse on me, ${choice-player-gender}[young man/young lady].
If you want another ${item-singular: 1[2]}, all you have to do ask.${prompt}

If you do not bring the ${item-singular: 1[2]} we gave you, my companion cannot warp you to ${choice: 2}[Ifrit's Cauldron/the Quicksand Caves/the Den of Rancor/Cape Teriggan/Fei'Yin/the Boyahda Tree].${prompt}
Did you remember to bring the ${item-singular: 1[2]}?${prompt}

Just as I thoughtaru. The prime avatar that you fought with this spunky-junky tuning fork was nothing but a fake. Researching real avatars with real tuning forks is how real researchers do real research in the real world!${prompt}
(Now if I could only find me some real work so I could do some real adventuring...)${prompt}

I don't think you'll get much out of it, but if you want to go get your buttaru kicked by the prime avatar again, all you have to do is ring another ${item-singular: 1[2]} near a giant crystal.${prompt}
Remember that you must fight the prime avatar as a level ${number: 3} summoner. As you already know, this will not be an easy task. Prepare well for the battle.${prompt}

Fork me baby, one more time.
Stick a fork in me, I'm done.${prompt}

These crystals are found all over Vana'diel, and their energies affect the surrounding ecosystems.
Our research team had been investigating the unusual emanations when POOF, out of nowhere, a prime avatar appeared and sliced 'n diced us down to size.${prompt}
Why do these avatars so despise talking with us that they would rather fight?
And what on Vana'diel would happen if someone were to defeat them?${prompt}

This isn't a Mog House, so you can only use the “Mog Safe,” “Change Jobs,” and “Delivery Box” commands, kupo.${prompt}

The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Next, you can begin to ${color: 5}feed fewell${color: 1} into the furnace to gradually raise the level of elemental concentration.
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
You'll need to perform periodic ${color: 5}furnace repair${color: 1} should the furnace near its breaking point.${prompt}
It is also possible to ${color: 5}recycle strewn fewell${color: 1} during synergy.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
First, equipment must be prepared by etching an aperture into which an elementally compatible piece of ${item-singular: 0[2]} can then be embedded.${prompt}
The type of aperture that may be etched will depend on the piece of equipment.
There are also pieces of equipment that, alas, may not be modified at all.${prompt}
If you are curious what manner of aperture may be etched into a particular piece of equipment, you need only trade it to me or one of my colleagues.${prompt}
As a general rule, the higher the level of the item in question, the more difficult the synergy process for creating an aperture will be.${prompt}
You will find that certain pieces of equipment may be etched with multiple apertures.
It is, however, only possible to create one aperture at a time.${prompt}
Etching requires the use of a corrosive substance we call mordant.
Deposit mordant into a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and the process will begin.${prompt}
My colleagues and I have a stock of mordant available for sale.
The best way to learn is to practice, so if you're curious, we encourage you to purchase some and begin experimenting!${prompt}
The difficulty of the synergy process when embedding evolith is decided by a number of factors.${prompt}
Such factors include the variety of aperture and evolith, as well as the quantity of evolith you seek to attach.
Embedding the first piece is not too difficult a task, but the second and third pieces will not go in so easily.${prompt}
To begin the embedding process, deposit your evolith into the synergy furnace along with a piece of equipment with a compatible aperture.${prompt}
When etching or embedding, the required elemental balance may be confirmed at any time during the synergy process, so let this be your guide.${prompt}
Should you ever wish to remove any apertures and embedded evolith from a piece of equipment entirely, you may do so with an ingredient we call ${color: 5}revertant${color: 1}.${prompt}
Toss the revertant in a synergy furnace along with your equipment, and its potent powers will restore your item to a pure and pristine state!
Be warned, however, that embedded evolith will be lost forever in the process.${prompt}
As you are no doubt already aware, synergy makes use of a highly combustible form of elemental crystals that we call “fewell.”
The more complex the recipe, the greater the quantity of fewell required.${prompt}
Veteran synergists know well the hassle of having to constantly monitor their fewell supply and procure crystals to replenish depleted stock.${prompt}
To free you of such trifling burdens and allow you to focus your mind entirely on your art, we synergy engineers are offering a convenient fewell replenishment service!${prompt}
For a nominal fee calculated based upon the current state of your fewell reserves, we will instantly refill you to full capacity.${prompt}
That's right--all elements in one simple transaction, directly to your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}!
Looking to fire up your furnace and enter the world of ${item-singular: 0[2]}?
If so, you've come to the right place!${prompt}
We're proud to offer a supply of the corrosive agent known as ${color: 5}mordant${color: 1} for sale.
With this, synergy newcomers can hone their skills and outfit their equipment with evolith-capable apertures in the process.${prompt}
Mind you, our stock is limited to only the most diluted, readily produced form of the stuff.
You'll find that it only has the strength to etch items of relatively low level.${prompt}
Etching high-powered equipment requires the use of more concentrated and potent forms of mordant.
As quantities are limited, we can offer these only in exchange for cinder.${prompt}
Those handy tricks of the trade that can mean the difference between a shiny new item and a major furnace meltdown.${prompt}
My colleagues and I are always eager to train fellow synergists in a wide range of techniques.
We can't do it all, though--you'll need to hone your synergy skill in order to benefit from our instruction.${prompt}
Bear in mind that certain techniques can only be imparted to students possessing specialized crafting knowledge.
For example, only skilled smiths will be able to comprehend the method for more efficient fewell feeding.${prompt}
Accomplished goldsmiths will be able to observe the inner workings of the furnace and stave off potential accidents.
You will find that all crafting skills--even those you may not expect--may be applied in some way to support the synergy process.${prompt}
Word has it that there are also pieces of equipment that can impart hidden synergy techniques to the wearer.
These, too, are said to be only accessible to skilled crafters.${prompt}
The moral of the story is this: while synergy skill is important, neglect not your other crafting skills.
To become a true synergy master, finding the proper balance is key.${prompt}
Synergy remains a young discipline, and researchers back at the institute are burning the midnight fewell in the hopes of uncovering the next breakthrough in our field.${prompt}
Research of late is centered around the cinder that is left behind as a by-product of each synergy operation.
Their composition, it would seem, has much to teach us of the true nature of the complex elemental reactions that go on within the bellies of these furnaces.${prompt}
We've even instituted a reward program for adventurers willing to contribute prime samples in the name of science.${prompt}
It would be no exaggeration to say that, to us, cinder is worth more than its weight in gold!

Errant troubadours spin tales of remnants sunk far beneath the Zafmlug Sea, claiming that these briny creatures nibble away at the encroaching kelp to keep the marble halls pristine.${prompt}
Perhaps they are naught more than tall tales, but some threads of truth give me pause.${prompt}
Ah, many a traveler has been wooed by the tale of the quicksilver blade, a myth from Aht Urhgan on the Aradjiah continent that locals hold to be true.${prompt}

An otherwise nondescript weaver spouted a most unusual experience he had when traversing the Silver Sea toward Azouph Isle. His vessel became shrouded in fog, and he scarce could see more than several ilms in front of himself.${prompt}
A blade of the purest silver burst from the sea and came crashing down, threatening to cleave the vessel from stem to stern.${prompt}
The young lad fainted from fright, and when he opened his eyes found himself surrounded on all sides by curious Qiqirns.${prompt}
The more superstitious of the common folk went stark mad, claiming that it was long-forgotten spirits from the Kingdom of Ephramad come to exact vengeance on the living.${prompt}
Fie, I say. Blades do not emerge from the depths of the sea. Doubtless it was a fish or similar sea creature of a more aggressive nature.${prompt}
But for such a piscine specimen to be mistaken for a blade of pure metal...the mind simply boggles, does it not?${prompt}
Some years ago there existed a seascape called Vunkerl Inlet in the region known as Derfland.${prompt}
Though many oceanic species dwelled in waters both shallow and deep, one in particular was said to be the apple of every fisherman's eye, for it was as bright as pure sunlight.${prompt}
I myself traveled to Derfland on one occasion, hoping to reel one in and make my name known throughout the land.${prompt}
But the claws of war plunged their way into my back and I was forced to retreat, my pride wounded as much as my flesh.${prompt}
Were I to recite my failures as a fisherman, that would doubtlessly be the first.${prompt}
Have you heard tales of the four legendary fish?${prompt}
They are ancient beings which numbered four: ${item-singular: 0[2]}, ${item-singular: 1[2]}, ${item-singular: 2[2]}, and ${item-singular: 3[2]}.${prompt}
Yet there were curious reports of a legendary fisherman who hauled in a fifth whose name was not listed in even the most complete fishing treatise.${prompt}
He was said to have found the beast in Misareaux Coast, abutting the Zafmlug Sea.${prompt}
Imitators quickly flocked to the area and cast their lines, hoping that fortune would smile on them...only to return hunched over and empty-handed.${prompt}
The fisherman came to be the laughingstock of his guild, ridiculed and belittled for claiming to catch something that by all accounts did not exist.${prompt}
One eve he departed the guild, never to be heard from again.${prompt}
Yet I cannot help but think there are grains of truth in that sandy story.${prompt}
Which reminds me...the tale goes that he cut open the stomachs of the four dragons and used the innards as bait.${prompt}
That leaves the small matter of the location...but I am quite certain you can figure it out.${prompt}

Far to the west lies the continent of Ulbuka, a land said to be at the heart of geomantic leylines. This story has been passed down from the primal geomancer through her five disciples and to the present day.${prompt}
Serpents are said to guard the vast natural energies pulsating in a cavernous region of the continent.${prompt}
These keepers of the gates fervently believe that the serpents are intimately connected with the lifestream and are immortal as long as that bond is not severed.${prompt}
Those selfsame keepers claim that something lives in the waters within the caves' deepest recesses.${prompt}
What fascinates me most about this legend is the idea that non-sentient beings can be connected to the lifestream.${prompt}
I have the utmost faith that if anyone could fish up a legend beyond legends, it would be you.${prompt}
And thus with bated breath I sit, anxiously awaiting your return.${prompt}
I-is that the presence of a legendary fish that I sense?${prompt}
Does that mean you reeled one in!? Quick, trade it to me forthwith!${prompt}
D-did you really find ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}? I had scarce dared to hope that the legends would be true...but you really found one!${prompt}
He likes eating alone. Please don't look.${prompt}
The birdie says that. Not me.${prompt}
${choice: 2}[Quite yummy!/Perfectly flavored!/Sweet yet savory!/Bold aftertaste!/Soft as silk!]${prompt}
He has a gift. Gift for you.${prompt}
You mean to let ${choice-player-gender}[him/her] lay claim to your title?${prompt}
My friend likes fish. Brings back good ones. Very yummy.${prompt}
I show good spots. We have much fun.${prompt}
Time to go now. Must find more fish.${prompt}
Ah, but you look confused. Allow me to explain--the exalted fisherman wasn't our Mithra of few words, but rather her apkallu.${prompt}
Even the most migratory of birds find it difficult to traverse all corners of the land.${prompt}
That's why he befriended her. She can take him to places ordinarily out of reach.${prompt}
Yet congratulations are in order nonetheless. I shall rue the day I ever doubted your capacity to lure in the most famous of catches.${prompt}
What is this? Your unbreakable spirit...quick, trade it to me!${prompt}
What is this? Your unbreakable spirit...quick, trade it to me!
Sweet heavens above! It is...it is...${prompt}
Your ${item-singular: 0[2]} begins to pulsate with a vibrant light!${prompt}

Despite all you have accomplished and the recognition that the exalted fisherman has given you, I know you will climb to greater heights--or is that dive to deeper depths?--and carve out an even greater legend.${prompt}
The path of a fisherman is unwavering and unceasing.${prompt}
...As long as your spirit remains unbreakable and indomitable.${prompt}
Have you no shame? I stumbled across this ${item-singular: 0[2]} and could think of only one person to wield it...${prompt}
Perhaps you are not as unbreakable as I once thought.${prompt}
I require one of the legendary fish...let's say ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]}. Only when you have returned with it will I bequeath the ${item-singular: 0[2]} to you once more.${prompt}
Should you desire your ${item-singular: 0[2]} to be returned, all you need do is procure ${article} ${item-article: 1[2]} and trade it to me.${prompt}
Even the thickest fog can be pierced by the purest of light.${prompt}
Ah, the spirit is mended, and now all is right with the world.${prompt}

That rod in your hand, standing so tall and proud--could it be...?${prompt}
Aha! A man's eyes may falter, but his sixth sense never lies!${prompt}
I would very much like to hear your frank opinion about such a masterpiece.${prompt}

Ah, it must be nice to have a rod that works even after many, many years of use.${prompt}
You must have treated it quite gently for it to remain responsive to your every touch.${prompt}
Ah, I see. Well, after many years of continuous use it was bound to need a rest.${prompt}
And the next day you dip it into the waters only to come up dry.${prompt}
Ah, but that stands to reason, does it not?${prompt}
Everything with a form eventually breaks or goes limp.${prompt}
But that is neither here nor there. Have you ever thought about making your ${item-singular: 0[2]} more...virile?${prompt}
Fear not. I shall not ask you to scour the corners of the globe hunting and pecking for things which may or may not exist.${prompt}
A true fisherman remains steadfast and tenacious in the face of all odds.${prompt}
I'll show you my tenacity if you show me yours.${prompt}
Let me think a little more.${prompt}
Aye, now there's a ${choice-player-gender}[strapping young lad/bold young lass]! Let's cut to the chase...${prompt}
First, I'll need you to reel in a large variety of fish. Let's see...yes, ${number: 0} different species will work. I leave it to you to choose which rod to employ.${prompt}

Next comes the completion of particular Records of Eminence objectives that test your stamina. Complete all entries in the “Fishing (Tenacity)” category while equipped with your ${item-singular: 0[2]}.${prompt}
Bring it back to my warm embrace once you have finished these two tasks and you shall have your just reward.${prompt}
A simple task for one of your...talents.${prompt}
Come back to me should you wish to have it measured. Your progress, that is.${prompt}
Until then, I bid you adieu and look forward to seeing what kinds of titillating specimens you have to bring back.${prompt}
Y-you have yet to complete the Records of Eminence objective ${unknown: 0x01054082808080}? A dark day for mankind, indeed.${prompt}
A proactive fisherman such as yourself would stand to profit much from completing the variety of fishing-related objectives found within.${prompt}
Your first task, then, is to head to ${zone: 0[2]} and speak with ${choice: 1}[Rolandienne/Isakoth/Fhelm Jobeizat] to be instructed in the basics.${prompt}
Not the exhibitionist type, then? Well, to each ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] own.${prompt}

I'll be here if you're ever ready to compare.${prompt}

Like an oasis cradled in the arms of the desert...like the blades of a windmill aching in the summer breeze...like the line of a fishing rod, taut and firm...${prompt}

As vivacious as it may be now, it still remains an object that can be broken.${prompt}

I have no choice but to make you another, for which I require ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}. Be warned: it'll take me some time to erect such a magnificent, towering rod.${prompt}

“Records of Eminence is a system brought to you by the caring folks at the Adventurers' Mutual Aid Network. Set your own objectives whenever you desire, and fulfill them to receive compensation.${prompt}
“To set these tasks, select 'Objective List' from the Quests menu, then choose ones that suit your fancy.${prompt}

“You will be rewarded with gil and sparks of eminence, which serve the same function as points, notes, credits, and other such methods of quantifying one's greatness. As an extra incentive, adventurers will earn three times the amount of sparks for completing an objective the first time.${prompt}
“Completed objectives will vanish from your quest list unless they are repeatable. In the event that you wish to make room for different objectives, you will need to remove them manually.${prompt}
“As a corollary regarding rewards, you'll be blessed with special remuneration once you complete several objectives. Bask in the joy of these pleasant surprises when you can.${prompt}
“Lastly, any and all acts of vandalism directed against your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} are strictly prohibited.${prompt}

Mandragora Mania is a game in which you battle for jingly by moving your mandragora pieces to the goal.${prompt}
Your goal is the ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] one on the right, while your opponent's is the ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] one on the left.${prompt}
At the start of the game, three mandragoras each will be placed on the eight game areas, excluding the goal.${prompt}
There are five starting placements (A through E), and you are able to select which one you would like to employ. The default setting is "Random."${prompt}
This explanation uses pattern A, but the basic rules are the same regardless of the starting pattern.${prompt}

The three ${choice: 0}[red/blue/green] areas in front of you are yours,${wait-36: 2}the three ${choice: 0}[blue/green/red] areas at the back are your opponent's,${wait-36: 2}and the remaining two are neutral.${prompt}
You must choose one area--either yours or a neutral one--to proceed.${prompt}
The areas are numbered from one to five starting from the left, and any mandragoras in the area you select will move.${prompt}
Conversely, your opponent must select either a neutral area or an area that belongs to them.${prompt}
From the right, those areas are numbered 6, 4, 7, 2, and 8.${prompt}
For example, if you select Area 1,${wait-36: 4}one mandragora will move to Area 2${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 3,${wait-36: 1}and one will move to Area 4.${prompt}
Note that the mandragoras will move from the back first--last in, first out.${prompt}
You will receive points known as “jingly” each time one of your mandragoras reaches the goal.${prompt}
You will enter your opponent's territory whenever you go past the goal.${prompt}

If one of your mandragoras happens to reach the opponent's goal, the goal will be pushed back and your mandragora will return to your own area. You don't have to worry about your mandragora earning any jingly for your opponent.${prompt}
The order in which players choose areas will be determined based on your turn settings. The default setting is random.${prompt}
This explanation has skipped past your opponent's turn for demonstration purposes, but in the actual game you and your opponent will take turns choosing areas.${prompt}
However, if the last mandragora to move reaches the goal, you will get to take an additional turn.${prompt}
Mandragoras are a very diverse species, and the amount of jingly you earn is determined by the species of mandragora that crosses into the goal.${prompt}
Adenium and citrullus: 3 jingly (first player)/4 jingly (second player).${prompt}
Korrigan and pachypodium: 2 jingly (first player)/3 jingly (second player).${prompt}
The game is over when either you or your opponent no longer has any mandragoras that can move.${prompt}
The player who has the most jingly at that point will be declared the winner.${prompt}
The key to victory lies in taking advantage of the various mandragora subspecies bonuses while claiming multiple turns in a row.${prompt}

I'll write them a letter, so please go on ahead.
